intro: Cryptantha jamesii var. typica, commonly known as the desert flax or desert blue flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Cryptantha jamesii var. typica plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
